meanings.definition: To cause to become dark or black in color, as by the deposit of melanin.
meanings.sent1: The sun's rays were melanizing the skin of the beachgoers.
meanings.sent2: The artist was melanizing the canvas with bold strokes of black paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried melanizing their friend's white shirt with a marker.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were melanizing the once bright sky, signaling an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The fire's smoke was melanizing the walls of the house, leaving a dark residue behind.

meanings.definition: To undergo a process of darkening or blackening, as by the deposit of melanin.
meanings.sent1: The fruit was slowly melanizing on the kitchen counter, ripening to perfection.
meanings.sent2: The leaves of the tree were melanizing in the autumn chill.
meanings.sent3: The old photograph was melanizing over time, capturing memories in sepia tones.
meanings.sent4: The night sky was melanizing as the sun dipped below the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The metal was melanizing under the intense heat of the forge, turning a deep shade of black.
